moves.1. e4: I'm white and use my standard open game e4!
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3 d6 3. Bc4 c6 4. Nf3 g6 5: His position is already a bit cramped, and I've got 2 more minor pieces developed then he does.
moves.6. d4 Bg7 7. O-O O-O 8. Qf3: At this point I have decided a brute force assault on the kingside is my best option.
moves.8... b5 9. Bd3: He forced me to move, and given his moves, the d3 square is where I wanted this bishop anyways.
moves.9... Bb7: This move gave my Queen free reign on the kingside.
moves.10. Qh3 Bc8: He realizes this and loses position and a tempo.
moves.11. e5 dxe5 12. dxe5 h6 13. Nge4 Nxe4 14: He doesn't know it yet but black just lost with that move.
moves.16. Bxg5 Qc7 17. Nf6+ Bxf6 18. Qxh6: In this position there's nothing he can do to save the game.  He can prolong it 1 move by Qxh2+, but i take QxQ then zip up to h7#.  Game over.
moves.18... Bxg5 19. Qh7#: And that's the game, thanks to the trusty clergyman on d3.
